plugins.name: Image Mono Palette
plugins.description: Image Palette is a Figma plugin designed to help you create seamless color schemes. Upload an image, and the plugin extracts its primary color to generate a customizable monochromatic color palette. Perfect for UI/UX designers, branding professionals, and creative projects, this tool simplifies the process of creating harmonious designs by providing tokens and placing the palette directly on your canvas. It's fast, intuitive, and tailored for creativity.

plugins.name: Populate JSON data
plugins.description: âœ¨ JSON-to-Design PluginðŸš€ Supercharge Your Design WorkflowBring your templates to life with data-driven automation! The JSON-to-Design Plugin allows you to effortlessly populate and duplicate designs using simple JSON files.Key Featuresâœ… Upload JSON FilesSupports two formats:Array format: Automatically duplicates selected designs for each object in the array while replacing placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}.{"array": [{ "name": "John", "surname": "Doe" },{ "name": "Emma", "surname": "Walker" },{ "name": "Liam", "surname": "Harris" }]}Object format: Updates a single design with JSON values without duplication.{"name": "John","surname": "Doe"}âœ… Dynamic Placeholder ReplacementReplace {{name}}, {{surname}}, or other placeholders in text elements with real dataâ€”seamlessly integrate information into your designs.âœ… Save Time and EffortEliminate repetitive manual tasks by automating data entry and duplication. Perfect for projects requiring consistent layouts with unique data sets.How to UseðŸŽ¯ Follow these simple steps to get started:Upload Your JSON FileUpload a correctly formatted JSON file using the plugin. Choose between the array format or object format depending on your use case.Select the LayerHighlight the Figma layer containing text objects with placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}. Ensure these placeholders are named correctly.Click â€œPopulate Designâ€Let the plugin work its magic! It will duplicate designs or populate data based on your JSON file.ðŸ’¡ Tip: Double-check placeholder names in your design to match JSON keys for smooth operation.Why Choose JSON-to-Design?ðŸ’¡ Smart Automation: Unlike other plugins, this tool simplifies both duplication and data replacement in one intuitive flow.â± Time-Saving Magic: Whether youâ€™re working with a few data points or hundreds, let the plugin handle the heavy lifting while you focus on creativity.
plugins.tagline: The plugin allows you to upload a JSON file and, based on it, populate designs with this data.

plugins.name: Table flipper
plugins.description: Hey :)This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.If the table is an instance, it will detach it.If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)Watch demo.Support my work here <3How to use:Select a frame that contains only a tableSelect the flip directionImportant notes:Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:Same amount of cells in all columnsSame amount of cells in all rowsSame width to all cells in row/columnOtherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.How it works behind the scenes:I calculate how many cells the table has by:How many rows/columnsHow many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)Enjoy :)(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)
plugins.tagline: Flip table's layout direction from rows to columns / columns to rows

108533.name: Table flipper
108533.description: Hey :)This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.If the table is an instance, it will detach it.If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)Watch demo.Support my work here <3How to use:Select a frame that contains only a tableSelect the flip directionImportant notes:Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:Same amount of cells in all columnsSame amount of cells in all rowsSame width to all cells in row/columnOtherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.How it works behind the scenes:I calculate how many cells the table has by:How many rows/columnsHow many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)Enjoy :)(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)

* Added option to support my work and buy me coffee

plugins.name: Recent frames
plugins.description: Work faster by quickly navigating back to the frames you recently worked on. The plugin displays a small window with a history of Figma frames you clicked. You can use the back button to quickly go to your last frames. Only top-level frames are listed; nested frames are ignored.Features:Back button to quickly navigate to a previously selected frame.List of recent frames: a single click centers the frame in your view, while a double-click auto-fits the zoom.Light and dark mode with native Figma UI style.Menu with special actions: quickly jump to the selected node in your local main component or select the same child node in all component instances.Why I Created It:I built this plugin because I work on complex Figma prototypes. I often need to copy something from a distant frame and then jump back to where I was working. I sometimes forget where I was in the project. I wanted a simple way to undo and return to my previous spot without any hassle.Use Cases:Effortlessly undo your navigation by returning to the last frame you clicked.Quickly jump between components and your working frames.Present your design flows without manual panning and zooming.
plugins.tagline: Instantly jump to your last frames with a back button

plugins.name: WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker (SC 1.4.4) for Design Systems
plugins.description: The WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker plugin designed to help you ensure that your design system components comply with SC 1.4.4: Resize Text (Level AA). This plugin helps verify that all text elements within your Figma designs behave appropriately when resized to 200% of their original size.Key features:200% text resize: duplicates the selected element and automatically applies 200% text resize to all text layers of the selected element.All component checking: works with text layers, groups, frames, auto-layout, and any other elements.Line height adjustments: allows you to update the line height according to the new size, or ignore it.

plugins.name: Stellar - Streamline Your Design Handoff
plugins.description: Stellar ðŸš€ empowers you to create organized and professional documentation for your design handoff. With four robust tools, you can structure your Figma files in a clean and intuitive manner.Frame Identifier - Ideal for pinpointing specific screens or components.Easily create clear headers to identify individual frames:Select any frame or group of elements.Add a title and subtitle.A polished header will be generated above your selection, enhancing clarity and organization.Section Identifier - Perfect for grouping features or user flows.Organize related frames with cohesive section headers:Select multiple frames that belong together.Add a section title and description.A header will be created that spans across all selected frames, providing a unified view.Flow Identifier - Essential for tracking progress and communicating state.Document your navigation flows with intuitive status indicators:Select frames within your user flow.Add a title and description.Choose a status (e.g., In Progress, Ready for Development).Status tags are color-coded and include helpful icons, making it easy to convey the current state.Connector Arrows - Connect your frames with intelligent arrows.Seamlessly link frames with dynamic arrows:Select two or more frames to connect.Choose from 4 arrow styles: Default Arrow (clean and simple), Success Arrow (positive flows), Error Arrow (error states), Dashed Arrow (alternative paths).Toggle between light and dark modes for optimal visibility.Arrows automatically adjust to frame positions, ensuring a tidy and logical layout.Perfect for:Design SystemsUser Flow DocumentationDevelopment HandoffProject Status TrackingTeam CollaborationStart organizing your Figma files with Stellar and create documentation that both designers and developers will appreciate! ðŸš€ðŸš€ðŸš€
plugins.tagline: Streamline your design handoff with organized headers, sections, and smart connectors

120497.name: Stellar - Streamline Your Design Handoff
120497.description: Stellar ðŸš€ empowers you to create organized and professional documentation for your design handoff. With four robust tools, you can structure your Figma files in a clean and intuitive manner.Frame Identifier - Ideal for pinpointing specific screens or components.Easily create clear headers to identify individual frames:Select any frame or group of elements.Add a title and subtitle.A polished header will be generated above your selection, enhancing clarity and organization.Section Identifier - Perfect for grouping features or user flows.Organize related frames with cohesive section headers:Select multiple frames that belong together.Add a section title and description.A header will be created that spans across all selected frames, providing a unified view.Flow Identifier - Essential for tracking progress and communicating state.Document your navigation flows with intuitive status indicators:Select frames within your user flow.Add a title and description.Choose a status (e.g., In Progress, Ready for Development).Status tags are color-coded and include helpful icons, making it easy to convey the current state.Connector Arrows - Connect your frames with intelligent arrows.Seamlessly link frames with dynamic arrows:Select two or more frames to connect.Choose from 4 arrow styles: Default Arrow (clean and simple), Success Arrow (positive flows), Error Arrow (error states), Dashed Arrow (alternative paths).Toggle between light and dark modes for optimal visibility.Arrows automatically adjust to frame positions, ensuring a tidy and logical layout.Perfect for:Design SystemsUser Flow DocumentationDevelopment HandoffProject Status TrackingTeam CollaborationStart organizing your Figma files with Stellar and create documentation that both designers and developers will appreciate! ðŸš€ðŸš€ðŸš€
120497.tagline: Streamline your design handoff with organized headers, sections, and smart connectors

plugins.description: (Ð ÑƒÑÑÐºÐ¸Ð¹ Ð²Ð½Ð¸Ð·Ñƒ ðŸ‘‡)en:This plugin localises all alias variables that refer to missing base variables (those located in external files or simply deleted)ðŸŽ¦ Video demonstration: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-LkWhy is this a problem?! Figma doesn't care about these links, it doesn't transfer them to the new file, but leaves the links to the companion variables (base/master variables) in the old file. And this isn't what you expect when you copy variables :)In simple words, what the plugin does:It looks for alias variables that have a reference to base variables that didn't make it to this file (either left in another file or simply missing)Creates copies of such variables in this fileRebinds the alias variable, changing the reference from the external master variable (base variable) to the newly created local oneWorks for variables of all types:color,text,boolean,numericIt should work with multiple mods, but I haven't tested this part.ru:ÐŸÐ»Ð°Ð³Ð¸Ð½ Ð¿Ð¾Ð¼Ð¾Ð¶ÐµÑ‚, ÐºÐ¾Ð³Ð´Ð° Ð²Ñ‹ Ð²Ð·ÑÐ»Ð¸ Ð¸ "Ñ‚ÑƒÐ¿Ð°" ÑÐºÐ¾Ð¿Ð¸Ñ€Ð¾Ð²Ð°Ð»Ð¸ Ð¿ÐµÑ€ÐµÐ¼ÐµÐ½Ð½Ñ‹Ðµ Ð¸Ð· Ð´Ñ€ÑƒÐ³Ð¾Ð³Ð¾ Ñ„Ð°Ð¹Ð»Ð°, Ð° Ñ‚Ð°Ð¼ Ð±Ñ‹Ð»Ð¸ Ð°Ð»Ð¸Ð°ÑÑ‹ (Ð¿ÐµÑ€ÐµÐ¼ÐµÐ½Ð½Ñ‹Ðµ ÑÑÑ‹Ð»Ð°Ð»Ð¸ÑÑŒ Ð½Ð° Ð´Ñ€ÑƒÐ³Ð¸Ðµ Ð¿ÐµÑ€ÐµÐ¼ÐµÐ½Ð½Ñ‹Ðµ).ðŸŽ¦ Ð’Ð¸Ð´ÐµÐ¾-Ð´ÐµÐ¼Ð¾Ð½ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ð°Ñ†Ð¸Ñ: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-LkÐÐ¾ Ð²Ð¾Ñ‚ Ð½ÐµÐ·Ð°Ð´Ð°Ñ‡Ð°! plugins.name: Frameverse
plugins.description: Frameverse - Share Frames SeamlesslyFrameverse is a powerful Figma plugin that revolutionizes design sharing. Generate secure tokens for your frames and assets, allowing instant access across teams and continents. Share specific design elements without exposing your entire file, maintaining control while enabling seamless collaboration.âœ¨ Key Features- One-Click Sharing: Select any frame, section, or slice and generate a shareable token instantly- Smart Import: Paste a token to import frames with perfect fidelity, maintaining all properties including:- Layout structures and constraints- Shapes and component instances- Vector paths and effects- Fonts and text styles- Images and fills- Batch Operations: Share or import multiple frames at once- Preview Panel: Visual preview of selected frames before sharingðŸŽ¯ Perfect For- Design System Teams sharing component updates- Agencies sharing design patterns with clients- Product Teams maintaining consistent layouts across files- Anyone looking to transfer frames between files without manual recreationðŸ’¡ How It Works1. Select the frames you want to share2. Click "Generate Token" to create a unique share code3. Share the token with your team4. Recipients paste the token to import frames with all properties intact (Eg: YJS-hoo)ðŸ”’ Security & Performance- Tokens are temporary and expire after 24 hours- No data persistence - files are fully purged after token expiration- Share specific frames without exposing entire files- Intelligent compression and processing for optimal performance- Progressive loading for larger framesNo account required. Start sharing frames in seconds!Questions or feedback? Contact us
plugins.tagline: Exchange assets with the most intuitive frame sharing solution for Figma

plugins.name: Eggstractor
plugins.description: Design-to-code, simplifiedEggstractor is a Figma plugin that exports designs as SCSS mixins, allowing developers to build components their way while keeping styling updates seamless. By separating structure from styling, Eggstractor ensures that design changes donâ€™t disrupt component architecture. And with automated code generation for updates, dramatically speed up iteration and reduce development overhead.Designers: Easily update component designs and push them directly to codeâ€”no developer implementation needed.Developers: Maintain full control over component structure while receiving Figma-driven style updates as branched pull requests for review before merging.For an end-to-end setup and demo, check out our Getting Started Guide.How It WorksConnect to your GitHub repo.Structure your coded components to use SCSS mixins.When designs change in Figma, run the plugin to generate updated SCSS mixins.Review, then click to create a pull request.A developer reviews and merges, and the changes are live.Current StatusEggstractor is actively in development. While not all CSS properties are supported yet, our roadmap includes full support for core CSS properties, followed by an open-source design system built to leverage Eggstractor.Eggstractor is an open source project by Bitovi. Contributions are welcome! Get involved at github.com/bitovi/eggstractor.Need some help?Check out our Getting Started Guide.Need more help?Chat with us on Discord | Send GitHub feature requests | Email to support@bitovi.comNeed pros to help design & build your design system or app? Thatâ€™s Bitovi!

plugins.name: Fancy Figma to Bricks builder
plugins.description: Forget doing things twice â€” design smarter by managing your variables, color palette and designs in Figma, then effortlessly transfer everything into Bricks builder with just a few clicks.Plugin video: https://youtu.be/5_52ZX3yfGQWebsite: https://fancyframework.com/figma-plugin/Purchase an early adopter license for 10 instances*: BUY NOWDocumentation: https://fancyframework.com/docs/Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/fancybricksYouTube: https://youtube.com/@fancybricks* An instance refers to each individual installation of the software, whether on different devices or platforms. For example, if you activate the license on the desktop app and also use it on the web version, even with the same user account, it will count as two separate instances.How it works?Fancy Framework for Figma streamlines your workflow in three simple steps â€” from defining your design system in Figma to building real pages in Bricks. Hereâ€™s how:Set up your design variables in FigmaDefine your entire design system directly in Figma â€” colors, typography, spacing, and more. Group and name your variables for better clarity and consistency across your designs.Export your variables and color palette to BricksWith just a few clicks, convert your Figma variables into Bricks-compatible values. Keep your color system consistent across design and development â€” no need to manually recreate anything.Copy from Figma, paste into BricksSelect any Auto Layout section in Figma, copy it, and paste it directly into the Bricks editor. Supports autolayout, semantic tags, classes, grids and native Bricks elements â€” just like you designed it.Main featuresFancy Figma to bricks builder plugin gives you everything you need to streamline your workflow: organize design variables, export color palettes, and paste fully structured sections directly into Bricks. No more duplicated effort â€” just clean, scalable, and efficient web design.Advanced variable supportUse calc, rem, number and clamp() directly in your Figma variables for greater flexibility and control.Auto-generate color variationsGenerate transparent, darkened, and lightened versions of your colors instantly â€” no need to create them manually. Perfect for building accessible and consistent UI systems.Export dynamic variables to BricksThanks to support for clamp, calc, rem, and numeric operations, your Figma variables are ready for real-world usage inside Bricks â€” no tweaks needed.Bricks-ready color palette exportAutomatically export your color palette from Figma, linked directly to your variables â€” ready to import into Bricks and use seamlessly across your entire site.Seamless copy-paste from Figma to BricksCopy any section built with Auto Layout in Figma and paste it directly into Bricks â€” layout structure, classes, and semantic tags all preserved.Copy-Paste FeaturesBuilt for Auto LayoutBy following best practices, your sections will copy perfectly into Bricks â€” layout, spacing, and hierarchy intact. Check out my free figma course: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbc4J3wWyVcdnL9A_UA-WdE2tXRUW-I8OSemantic HTML tag supportYour Figma sections can include semantic tags like [section], [container], [ul], [li], [h1â€“h6], [p], [span], and more. Perfect for SEO, accessibility, and clean markup.Support for display gridDisplay grid support uses (grid-x) (grid-x-x) to apply display: grid in Bricks automatically when pasting.Class-friendly workflowUse meaningful class names in Figma and watch them transfer seamlessly into Bricks. Combine with utility classes for maximum flexibility and control.Bricks-native element compatibilityPaste sections that automatically map to Bricks' native elements like:ButtonsLinksSVGFormsTabsAccordionsNav menuLogoCountersBreadcrumbsFilter searchFilter checkboxMore will be added

plugins.name: Background Color Generator
plugins.description: Summary:This plugin is ideal for B2B products where you want to integrate a clientâ€™s branding color into background designs while maintaining accessibility and strong visual contrast.How to use:Pick a color using the hue slider or a HEX code. Select the layer you want to apply the color to, then simply click the button to apply it. The plugin generates light and dark variations with the same hue.Accessibility Compliance:This plugin follows the WCAG 2.1 guidelines for color contrast:The light color is optimized for contrast against 87% black (#161616), and the dark color against white (#FFFFFF).For normal text (below 18pt bold / 24pt regular), the minimum contrast ratio is 4.5:1.For large text (18pt bold or 24pt regular and above), the minimum contrast ratio is 3:1.The generated light and dark color combinations exceed these minimum requirements, ensuring better readability and accessibility for users with visual impairments.(Note: I made this plugin from Ai integrated in VS code. If you want to know more about what I do at work, you can check Daidai )
plugins.tagline: Color generator for light and dark backgrounds.

plugins.name: MGS Composer - Exporter
plugins.description: Export your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer ProjectStreamline your design workflow with the MGS Composer Exporter. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design environment and MGS Composer, enabling you to create stunning user interfaces in Figma and transfer them to Composer for further development.FeaturesAutomatic Asset Generation: Composer generates assets automatically from the exported data, saving time and effort.Preserved Design Hierarchy: Composer mirrors Figma's design tree as closely as possible, ensuring an accurate translation of your design.Component Support: Assets generated from Figma Components are treated as a shared resource, saving memory on your target device.Detailed GuideHow to Use:Install the Plugin: Add it to your Figma workspace.Run the Plugin: An export window will appear on the right side of Figma's interface.Select Page: Navigate to the page you want to export from and click Select Page.Mark Objects for Export: The export window will list top-level objects. These will be translated to Screens in Composer. Select objects by clicking on them or their children in the Figma design, which will automatically mark them in the export window.Set Export Options: After selecting objects, choose from two options:Flatten Group Components during export: Flattens groups into a single image in the exported data.Export all primitives as .svg assets: Exports vectors like rectangles, lines, and text as SVG assets.Generate Data: Click the Generate Data button. The export window will show a view of all exported objects and a corresponding JSON file. You can add custom properties to the objects here in the upper view.Export File: Click the Export button at the bottom of the window and select a location to save the file.Open MGS Composer: Launch Composer and create a new design or open an existing one with a screen size adequate for your Figma content.Import Project: In Composer, go to "File > Import" and select Figma Composer Project. Confirm the prompt that appears.Done: Composer will import the file and add new screens, assets, and widgets to your design.Support & Feedback:MGS User GuideMGS Forum
plugins.tagline: Exports your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project.

112358.name: MGS Composer - Exporter
112358.description: Export your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer ProjectStreamline your design workflow with the MGS Composer Exporter. These will be translated to Screens in Composer. Select objects by clicking on them or their children in the Figma design, which will automatically mark them in the export window.Set Export Options: After selecting objects, choose from two options:Flatten Group Components during export: Flattens groups into a single image in the exported data.Export all primitives as .svg assets: Exports vectors like rectangles, lines, and text as SVG assets.Generate Data: Click the Generate Data button. The export window will show a view of all exported objects and a corresponding JSON file. You can add custom properties to the objects here in the upper view.Export File: Click the Export button at the bottom of the window and select a location to save the file.Open MGS Composer: Launch Composer and create a new design or open an existing one with a screen size adequate for your Figma content.Import Project: In Composer, go to "File > Import" and select Figma Composer Project. Confirm the prompt that appears.Done: Composer will import the file and add new screens, assets, and widgets to your design.Support & Feedback:MGS User GuideMGS Forum
